text: rtj trail rocks

name: Jackie Peeples
text: rtj trail rocks

name: Jackie Peeples
text: rtj trail rocks

name: Jackie Peeples
text: rtj trail rocks

name: Adam Denault
text: Looking at new clubs, the staff was super helpful.

name: ThePopeGaming
text: Outstanding selection of equipment

name: Christopher Dill
text: Never been here but it's probably a nice place don't know why the system decide to turn on my list to talk about

name: Brie
text: Great place

name: Craig Moore
text: I love this course. It was a private club for years. It is now a public course that is owned and maintained by the city park and rec department. Beautiful landscaping. State of the art carts are always charged up. Challenging layout. Multiple tee boxes make it easy for a beginner and challenging for a veteran. Theres even a phone box on the 9th tee box; so you can call the restaurant/bar and put in an order. By the time you finish hole, its a 3 second cart ride to snacks and drinks waiting for you. Very nice locker room in the clubhouse, with built-in, wooden lockers. The Pro shop inside has lots of accessories and clothing for your golf game. On the East side of the course, there is a nice tennis court area with multiple courts. Also has a swimming pool, gym, and fancy locker rooms.

name: madskrillz2
text: I still love this course but they have jacked their prices up WAY too high. I guess that's what happens when you lose money every year. You can go to RTJ and play for 5 dollars cheaper and play on a course  that is at least twice as nice. I still love the layout and their greens. Just can't bring myself to pay nearly 50 dollars for a 30-35ish dollar course.

name: Craig Farris
text: Love the pool

name: Georgia Patterson
text: No comment

name: John-Paul Morgante
text: Hills and uneven lies everywhere. Greens fast and tricky too. Wonderful conditions.

name: Darlene Henderson
text: This place is Awesome the grounds are beautiful the staff is on point! Happy New Year

name: Tony Craig
text: It was a wonderful and Exciting experience having the opportunity to play and Perform for a Wedding Reception at the NORTHRIVER GOLF CLUB. AN AWESOME PLACE TO HAVE YOUR WEDDING RECEPTION!

name: Stephen Flack
text: beautiful views and great staff

name: Brandon Robb
text: Love this place. Grandparents live here and I just love this place. Very friendly staff

name: Brandon R.
text: Awesome facility for people who, golf, play tennis and or, own a boat. Loved this place while growing up

name: Genelle Pernia
text: Always spot on...best Bleu cheese dressing on the planet!

name: brandon robb
text: Great Country club in, a great location on, Lake Tuscaloosa

name: Kristy Ryan - McKnight
text: Great food and service.

name: Matt McComb
text: Great lunch

name: Kurt
text: Very nice!

name: Woody Norman
text: Excellent

name: Aaron Kurczi
text: I give this 5 because I cannot hold against this course what the weather has done to some areas of it. The greens were great though and the layout i phenomenal. The owner was also very nice. I would definitely play here again.

name: Belinda Hutchinson
text: Great place to have a wedding or any social event! Very clean and just an overall nice facility.

name: Georgia Turner Goodwine Christian
text: Enjoyed many events at this location

name: Jesse Hollingsworth
text: Very pretty course with great scenery. The greens here are some of the toughest greens I have ever experienced. If you are up for a challenge, this is a neat course to play.

name: Kim Melton
text: We had my niece's baby shower at Cumberland today and it was super nice. The place has amazing views and Veronica runs the place top notch!

name: r b
text: My first time there and I was impressed..Veronica is a very good manager...she is on top of the flow of players..

name: Brian Tolzman
text: Veronica was great!  The course was in rough shape. They did have bad weather however don't think that affected the conditions though.

resp.text: Not a correct assessment.  Condition and layout, one of the best in the area at this price point.

name: jullie hallman
text: Beautiful

name: Tangy Bodie
text: My husband and 3 others drive over 1 hr to play this course. When they got there a lady was working the club house. They informed her that they had reserved a tee time at 12:30. She was soooo nasty to them. She threw her hand up to cut them off and informed them that there were no carts available for 30-40 mins. The guys were ok with this since they would hit the driving range up in the meantime. It was her holier than thou attitude that made them mad. The owner was contacted and he defended her saying she sometimes comes off as rude, he did however go speak to the men and offered them a Gatorade as compensation... Yes will deff not be back! But they did say the course was nice.

resp.text: The real story of this review is that Tangy Bodie whatever her name may be, wasn't even at the golf course.   This is more of a story of how she can attempt to extract extreme compensation for the threat of a bad review.  From the moment speaking with Alexis on the phone the conversation quickly became "what kind of compensation will you give me??"  Meaning she wanted me to refund over $ 160.00 in greens fees because of her threats of a poor review.   I went out to the course and spoke to the gentlemen about the incident.  They were delayed only 5 minutes from their tee time.  My worker could have had a cooler head dealing with customers, but an apology was made and the men appeared to be happy that I looked into the situation. I offered to buy them a round of beers as a friendly gesture.   I am more than willing to accept a one star review than cower to a person trying to extort money in lieu of a bad review.   Cumberland Lake GC is one of the finest golf courses in Birmingham at its price point.  And, we also have some very fine individuals working behind the counter.  Please judge for yourself.

name: Mike Hamner
text: Really nice course, fairways and greens were very playable, challenging layout. Will definitely want to play it again.

name: Michael Dennis
text: Love it such a nice place to hang out and supper friendly  staff!!!

name: Jackie Aronhalt
text: My husband golfed 2 rounds here and loved it! I enjoyed the huge (amazingly clean) pool, food, drinks and view. Awesome!

name: Daniel Banks
text: Great little course. Played it while in Birmingham on business. Greens were a little slow, but rolled smooth. Fantastic layout. Will play again next time in town.

name: Jane Aronhalt
text: New ownership has made amazing turn around. Beautiful course. Love the views. Looking forward to booking a group event.

name: David SMith
text: Course is looking really good! They seem to be making a lot of improvements. Best deal in town at $23 on Tuesdays!

name: Brandon Shirah
text: Love the layout. Course was bought by a group of people and since then they have let the course go a little bit. New new groundskeeper to take pride in the course.

name: Homer Marlowe
text: By far in the best shape it has ever been in thanks to a  new grounds keeper  sent from heaven an new managers that are looking out for the members a great place to jone

name: Parker Cantrell
text: 19th hole has some of the sweetest people around. Worth the trip

name: Lavador Sizemore
text: Beautiful golf course, i worked at this golf course back in 1996 and 97 alot of good memories!

name: Terry Crane
text: Greens are fast. Course in good shape

name: Byron Dixon
text: Very friendly staff. Great rates.

name: Harrison Jones
text: Nice place.

name: Rodney Moody
text: Really good. Great place to teach a beginner and/or work on your game on a rainy day especially.

name: Rob Malone
text: Great fun, good beer prices.

name: Conner Jung
text: Great service and at a good price but the sensor was only picking up every other swing for some reason. Could have been just me though.

name: John Hollingsworth
text: Had a great time.  It's not the real thing but when you can't be on the course this is a great place to play.

name: Douglas Mitchell
text: Awesome place to take coworkers!

name: Hornaday quickfire
text: Awesome! I have never golfed but son wanted to try. Let me be clear....reserve your booth early! We called at noon to reserve at 4. The golf experience was great! Staff was terrific! Explained everything. We had fun. Ordered pizza and root beer. Pizza was overpriced, overcooked, frozen pizza. But this isn't a restaurant. Pizza was a snack, same quality at bowling alley or arcade. At the end of the day, yes I will go back.

name: Derek smith
text: Nice staff. Just as advertised. Bring your own clubs ever if you aren't any good. They have some but can't accommodate everyone for all clubs and lengths.

name: Jordan Giada
text: Cool place, cool people, plus you can smash golf balls and watch sports!

name: Ben Duckworth
text: Fantastic time, fantastic staff, and Cold beer how can you go wrong

name: Spencer Callahan
text: I have a blast every time I'm at Fairways. They have a great craft beer selection and the golf simulators provide great feedback for working on your swing, or you can just go and have a good time while enjoying the awesome graphics and wide range of courses. What's better than drinking a good beer and hitting golf balls? Not much... and now you can do it when it's dark or when it's raining outside!

name: Alabama Lucey
text: Only place I know of in Mobile to play inside golf.  They have a bar to get drinks but didn't offer real food, just some snacks.  They had four simulators.  We went on a Thursday and didn't have to wait.  My only real complaint was we paid for an hour, the machine froze up a couple of times and they kept the clock running while we waited for the attendant and while she was fixing it. A little steep on price but if it's raining or very hot it gives you another option.

name: Haley S
text: I love the atmosphere at Fairways and their monthly wine tastings are so much fun! Great drink selections and friendly bartenders. And you can golf any time no matter what the weather is like!

name: Alan Chastain
text: This is the perfect place to go to work on your swing especially here in Mobile since it rains so much. The golf simulators helped me work on my swing and I couldn't believe how many different national golf courses you could play on!

name: Zachary C
text: Great place, fun people, Golden Tee golf for the win!

name: Katherine Lovvorn
text: I love going to hangout and grab a drink! It's so fun to play golf indoors and not deal with the heat!

name: Dylan Stovall
text: Cool new place to hit some balls and have a few drinks. Good atmosphere and friendly staff.

name: James Duke
text: Great activity to get out of the summer heat. Reasonable pricing when you bring a group. Full bar available to keep you refreshed.

name: Russell Boren
text: Great customer service and atmosphere, the simulators just are not that accurate

name: Timothy Clark
text: Lots of fun and the price wasn't bad! Golf with air conditioning! Need I say more??

name: Dylan Sweatt
text: Nothing else like it on the gulf coast. Great place to go with friends

name: Rhen Bartlett
text: Fairways is awesome! Play golf in the AC and they have the best beers on tap!

name: Leigh Wright
text: Always a good time! Matt is a great bartender

name: kbarre06
text: This is the coolest idea! They have a full service bar and golf simulators with tons of different courses!

name: Joni Ward
text: Great service. Lots of fun.

name: NIkki Seabrook
text: First time I had ever been here and had a great time!

name: David Wright
text: Good place to play but would rather play top golf

name: William Fleming
text: Always a fun time!

name: Patrick Summerlin
text: It's something to do on a rainy day.

name: Mohammed ALKhateeb
text: Quite place

name: Johnny Collins
text: Machines r not that good. Over priced

name: Michael McCarthy
text: Fun experience

name: Michael Cummings
text: Great staff, a true hidden gem!

name: Synia Smith
text: Drinks and golf. What a plus that its inside

name: Anna Collins
text: It's very expensive and not well maintsined

name: Christopher Hefner
text: 50 people in line only 2 checkouts  open took about 45min to get threw the line

name: The Family
text: Great place

name: Cindy Strait
text: Love this store just for walking around

name: Tristen Bissonnette
text: The course has a great layout but is being poorly maintained. The greens were awful, barely even playable and the tee box’s have seen their better day. This could be a great golf course if they can improve the quality of the grass and greens. Was way over priced for what it is. You are basically playing in open pasture.

name: Shane Brewer
text: What a difference from 8 months ago...course is now trash! Greens are impossible to putt on. Tee markers have been removed from most teeboxes?!? A reasonable price for current conditions would be $19.99 max. Photo of 18 teebox. Gave 2 stars only because guy at the counter was nice.

name: pamler fowler
text: We are here as a group, they don’t have any carts for the group and staff are very unhelpful. Per the management we are not to get any carts. They did have any range balls for the group of 80 plus and yes they knew we would be here and agreed to host. I have not this level of negativity at any course.

name: Margaret Ezell
text: Love the club! Very economical. Friendly faces. I met some of my dearest friends at Prattville Country Club.

name: Clayton Bush
text: Service was very good.

name: Samantha Oates
text: This could be a really great semi private golf course.  Wonderful layout....need to turn off sprinklers during time that golfers are playing.  That should be done at night maybe.  Members need to be less rude to non members who come to play as their financial support is obviously needed to keep the club operating.

name: Keith Oates
text: Go somewhere else.Unless you are a member.They turned into a semi private club.Why,you may ask.Because their members cannot afford to keep doors open.But non members get treated really bad.I suggest going to emerald mountain. Better course,greens,and price.They lost $200 a weekend on us.Members should treat guests better than the members.Because they are the ones that will keep your doors open,you can't.

name: Kenny Edwards
text: One of my favorite places to go

name: Ip Man
text: How can y’all be saying this place is great?  The greens are terrible and overpriced

name: Norman Gerald
text: Course is getting better each week, and the prices are fair. Also Vets/ First responders play super cheap!

name: Marjan Hautekiet
text: Great club with pool for all ages. You can spend  hours  here to play with  kids. Thé  staff  is also super friendly. There is always space to park thé car.

name: Jerry Grace
text: Fun..challenge..priced great...plumb your putts, then do the opposite..up is down...down is up...awesome course

name: Harry Knight
text: Enjoy watching my grandson play with the Prattville High School.

name: Bobby Gillespie
text: If your looking for a good game theres one there everyday at 12. Also, it is a great place for lunch and dinner and has a awesome pool and pool house.

name: Scott Staton
text: Nice place. Few water hazards.

name: Phil Hesterman
text: Service was extremely slow and the food was horrible. I do not recommend eating there.

name: Makeupby Mimi
text: Great place!

name: Joe Mann
text: Bunch of snobs

name: Rodney Johnsey
text: Greens need to be mowed properly. To slow to take the breaks. Bring some bug spray.

name: Cody Watson
text: Beautiful layout but greens were slow.

name: Sarah Y.
text: Beautiful scenery and wonderful staff! Everyone is really nice and helpful and the course is very well laid out! Would recommend :)

name: Loucrita Batton
text: Beautiful, challenging, and had great time here.

name: hiep ma
text: It's great perfect condition

name: Mark Williams
text: Shape of the course was not good. The layout and area are amazing. It has so much potential. The greens are bent grass that is pretty much dead. I wanted to love this course but the greens made it hard.

name: Rusty Bennett
text: Great layout. Tees and fairways in great shape. Traps are in awful shape. Greens are in fair shape, but roll decent. Would play it again. Decent deal.

name: Dennis Knuth
text: Great layout, beautiful scenery... greens need some attention...staff was very professional and accommodating, breakfast was incredible....

name: Evan Agnew
text: Overpriced for the shape the course is in. $60 for an afternoon round is crazy. Several tee boxes didn't have grass and lots of dead areas on the green. Not a bad layout and fairways were in good shape.

name: J. Paul Wilson
text: This course was in great shape. Great layout!

name: Trace Palmer
text: Once they put some money into  it, it will be a 5 star course again.. It's a shadow of its once greatness. Greens have fungus,  bunkers full of grass, tall weeds in the uncut rough  but fairways are still in good shape..  it's an excellent layout but until new managment renews everything it only deserves 2 stars.

name: Chris Sakaguchi
text: Not as bad as some recent reviews indicated, but not what it once was. Greens are coming back and the poa has been treated. Give it a few more weeks and it should be better. Bunkers are atrocious but hey, not suppose to hit it there! A little more TLC and this course could be great again.

name: Randy Carroll
text: A great layout with a friendly staff. They don't appear to have enough financial support to take care of it.

name: Jsmajors@centurylink.net Majors
text: Good golf course not too long

name: Mark Priest
text: Course is an awful shape. Course is dry as a bone. Prices are outrageous. Greens are in bad shape. Sand traps are unplayable. There aren’t any 150 yard markets. The yardages on sprinklers and the concrete blocks on the tees do not tell you that those measurements are to the front of the green. Also, the course needs to use a colored tee system so that you can actually find the tees that you want to play. Overall, very disappointed that this course has gone way downhill in every way possible.

name: Steven Banks
text: Beautiful scenery and layout, but the worst golf course I've ever played. Nothing but weeds on the tees and fairways and they don't even mow them. Fairways were as tall as the rough. Greens had dead patches all over them. Paid $60 to play and it was probably worth about $15.

name: Payten Burns
text: Very Very nice

name: Mike Winchell
text: Beautiful golf course.  Nearly every hole is a photo op. Start hole one from the tips if you can. Great elevated view. They had a wedding on the tee box the night before we arrived due to the view. The course is not crowded so it is one of those secret gems you feel fortunate to find. Forgiving fairways. Great golf experience. I am looking forward to golfing there again. It was worth the drive.

name: Kerry Holeton
text:
Greens need some TLC
Rough area could be better kept
Bunkers need to be redone

name: Linda Raylene Sparks
text: Beautiful place and a fantastic course. Wonderful management and staff

name: Wayne Nall
text: Perfect views on every hole. The Greens are rolling great.most fun lay out course to play. Staff is the best. Highly recommended!!!! Don't pass it up.

name: Dustin Schwaiger
text: First time ever posting a review on google. This golf course is horrible. Fairways are nothing but weeds. Rough is nothing but weeds. It’s impossible to play the ball down out there. Bunkers have no sand on the lips. Some bunkers have grass growing in them. Some have liners showing. Greens have dead spots all over every green. Some tee boxes are nothing but weeds. Some have no grass. Members still act like the course is still in prime shape. Paid $25 to play there and still felt like I overpaid.

name: Josh Lawler
text: Turf was nice and soft, a little on the pricey side but is a must play for Blount County. Great course on a hot day, lots of shade and water coolers we're frequent (our trip was 93 degrees). We will return here through the heat of the summer.

name: Suzanne Butler (Where2Golf)
text: Nestling in a valley between two ridges of tree-covered hills, the up-market residential development of Limestone Springs can boast a championship golf course that is a delight from first to last. With unobtrusive villas skirting only a few holes, the course retains all the naturalness and tranquillity of this Appalachian foothills environment.

name: Chris Mahan
text: This is a beautiful place with upscale environment and friendly staff. They were incredibly busy, but made me feel like I was the most important person in the room. I don't play golf, but am seriously considering picking up the sport just to have an excuse to come back here on a regular basis.

name: J L
text: The overall experience was a bit of let down because I had heard so many good things about this course. I traveled more than an hour away as well as the friends I invited and was pretty embarrassed by the conditions of the greens. I could see how this place would be beautiful if it was well maintained but every green had some sort of sun damage or grass issues. The temporary greens were not even cut so it was as if you were putting in the rough. The water coolers had no ice and we never once saw a cart asking if we wanted anything. Im writing an honest review so that others won't have the same bad experience that I did. I hope they fix things because the overall scenery is beautiful

name: James Banken
text: Good golf course. Friendly, after talking to locals, it had not been maintained like in the past. I would return tho.  I went in October and if you play there, bring gnat spray.

name: T Garrett Neill
text: Mixed feelings.  At one time, one of the top courses in the state, and certainly my favorite.  Played today for the first time in a while, and although the course is nice, it is NOT the experience and condition that it once was.  It appears that they are working hard, but the edges are a bit rough.  Greens good, but slow.  Carts have been allowed to go almost anywhere.  It's a bit like the local good ol' boys have taken over.  I played behind 4 groups of 5 apiece, playing their own ball.  Took about 4:40 to play 18 as a single.  No chance of playing through or an offer to.  Should not have 5somes.  Staff was nice, decent food.  Fortunately,  I came on a Monday for a $50 rate.  If it was weekend it would have been $90!  Tough to justify driving an hour from Hoover.  I will play here again, but not motivated to try again quickly.

name: Gary Chevalier
text: One of my fav's, bunkers were sketchy the last time l played there. People are great and course layout is great.

name: Jan Mooney
text: Very pleasant. Food was very good

name: Matt Clickner
text: Stayed in the cabins here for a golf weekend, great accommodations and easy access to the course. Course felt like it would have fit in with the Robert Trent Jones courses, well kept and nice layout.

name: Will Denton
text:
This review hurts me to write because this course used to be one of my favorites in the Birmingham area.  But that is just simply not the case anymore for this course. $70  +cart  on a Tuesday is a totally rip off. The greens on October 24 where so bad and the fairways had been cut but the clippings left in the fairway.

For this price point go to farm links or any of the Trent Jones trails.

Sad how far this course had fallen

name: Greg Keller
text: In great shape!!

name: Ryan M (RDM41)
text: Great neighborhood with an awesome course. Highly recommend.

name: Walla Hatchee
text: "Limestone Springs has also been consistently rated 4 ½ stars by Golf Digest’s Places to Play, ranked in the top five public golf courses in Alabama by GolfWeek, and named to America’s Top Golf Courses by Zagat Survey"

name: Terry Roll
text: Great golf course

name: Zachary “Z Money” Cardwell
text: This is hands down one of if not the best golf course in the entire state of Alabama.

name: Paula ksm
text: Great golf course

name: James Bradley
text: To high prices. Food not so good

name: catherine myers
text: Beautiful venue!!

name: Jeff Morris
text: Very nice

name: Skylar Nelson
text: Legit. But also legit in the middle of nowhere. No cell service.

name: James Chapman
text: Great employees, great fun!

name: Kevin Robbins
text: Good golfing experience

name: Craig Magruder
text: Love this place!   Awesome!

name: 太田雅広
text:
(Translated by Google) beautiful

(Original)
きれい

name: Josh A
text: It's was good. Smaller, but cost is great to have a good time and take beginners too. Only thing I would say is just needs a little more up keep.

name: Spunky Tolbert
text: Always enjoy my time at the whipping!!!!!

name: Ty Cole
text: Y’all are crazy if you give this thing any more than a 1 star review. If you like putting on burnt greens, sand, and crab grass then this is the course for you. Can’t hardly tell the difference in the “fairway” and the “greens”. Pay the extra $5 to play at any other course in the area.

name: Jonathan Ary
text: Giving this course 5 stars just because it's a fun relaxing time of playing golf.  Do not expect a PGA course based on my rating.  This is a family owned course and the cost is a real value.

name: Epic Account
text: Low cost at only 18$ for 18 holes and a cart, but you cant tell the difference between the rough and the fairway. The greens are not very good either.

name: Sally freichs
text: Awesome golf course. Great prices and fun holes. Friendly staff. Will be back!! Highly recommend!!

name: Jay Williams
text: Whippoowill Golf Course now has new golf carts! Everyone come down and check us out! We offer a great golfing experience for a low price, we look forward to seeing you soon!

name: Wesley Carnley
text: Might not be much but it’s a fun place to play, good value, great staff, always treat you like family.

name: Dwight Christian
text: Great place to gold. Good prices and good ownership. Would recommend to anyone.

name: Josette O'Brien
text: In a very small town of Snead is a nice little golf course. It's not the top notch but it's a very reasonable price and not very strict on attire.

name: Nick Swain
text: A little rough around the edges... but I love playing here!

name: Greg Barbee
text: It's a good place to play golf.

name: James Matthews
text: Great day

name: Rodger Kilgore
text: Great people and a lot of fun.

name: Cecil Latta
text: Nice place to play golf out in the country

name: DJ Hamilton
text: Great course for a great price, I love it!

name: Debra Gibbs
text: Good golf

name: daniel obrien
text: Nice, quiet, and casual.
